oai_dc:dc.dc:title: WAVE-CURRENT INTERACTIONS IN INLETS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Briggs, Michael J.
Demirbilek, Zeki
Green, Debra R.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wave/current interaction
inlet
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Laboratory experiments were conducted in a flume to study wave-current interaction at the entrance to an inlet. Regular and irregular waves were studied with and without ebb and flood currents. These data are being used to develop a parameterization of the wave breaking criterion in the presence of currents in inlets, provide guidance to the field on the effects of currents on waves, and improve the predictive capability of numerical models for enhancing navigation in inlets.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 25 (1996): Proceedings of 25th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Orlando, Florida, 1996.
